ciscopress book page 382:
These bulk accounts can be imported from a comma-separated values (CSV) document or
created at random.

Which two methods should a sponsor select to create bulk guest accounts from the sponsor portal?
A. Random
B. Monthly
C. Daily
D. Imported
E. Known

Selected Answer: AD
The two methods that a sponsor should select to create bulk guest accounts from the sponsor portal are Imported and Known.

 Imported allows the sponsor to import a list of guest users from a CSV file. This is a good option for creating bulk guest accounts for events or other situations where you know the names and contact information of the guests in advance.
 Known allows the sponsor to create guest accounts for guests whose personal information is known to the sponsor. This is a good option for creating bulk guest accounts for employees or other authorized visitors who have visited the organization before.

questions.question_text: Which two methods should a sponsor select to create bulk guest accounts from the sponsor portal? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
The provided answer is correct.
There are three default Guest portals:

Hotspot Guest portal: Network access is granted without requiring any credentials. Usually, an Acceptance of User Policy (AUP) must be accepted before network access is granted.

Sponsored-Guest portal: Network access is granted by a sponsor who creates accounts for guests, and provides the guest with login credentials.

Self-Registered Guest portal: Guests can create their own account credentials, and may need sponsor approval before they are granted network access.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/ise/2-4/admin_guide/b_ISE_admin_guide_24/m_ise_guest.html#ID32

Selected Answer: B
Provided answer is correct

questions.question_text: What is a valid guest portal type?

discussion.content:
I believe this the correct answer should be D :
https://www.packetmischief.ca/2012/02/09/cisco-ise-and-ip-http-server/

D)
SISE ebook:
"Enable the Switch HTTP/HTTPS Server
The embedded HTTP/HTTPS server in IOS is used to grab HTTP traffic from the user and redirect that user’s browser to the Centralized Web Authentication portal or to a device registration portal or even to the mobile device management onboarding portal. This same function is used for redirecting the posture agent’s traffic to the Policy Services node. 

Follow these steps to enable the switch HTTP/HTTPS server:

Step 1. Enable the HTTP server by entering the following command in global configuration mode:
C3850(config)# ip http server

Step 2. Enable the HTTP secure server by entering the following command:
C3850(config)# ip http secure-server"

Selected Answer: A
The purpose of the ip http server command on a switch is to enable the https server for users for web authentication. This means that when a user connects to the switch, they will be redirected to a web page where they can enter their username and password. If the username and password are correct, the user will be granted access to the network.

The other options are incorrect.

 dot1x authentication is a type of Layer 2 authentication that uses 802.1X. It is not enabled by the ip http server command.
 MAB authentication is a type of Layer 2 authentication that uses MAC addresses. It is not enabled by the ip http server command.
 The switch does not redirect users for web authentication. The user is redirected to the web page by the switch's HTTP server.

questions.question_text: Which configuration is required in the Cisco ISE authentication policy to allow Central Web Authentication?

discussion.content:
Step 2. Expand Authentication policy. For the MAB rule (match on wired or wireless MAB), expand Options, and choose the CONTINUE option in case you see 'If User not found'.

The answer is A.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/wireless/catalyst-9800-series-wireless-controllers/213920-central-web-authentication-cwa-on-cata.html

Selected Answer: A
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/wireless/catalyst-9800-series-wireless-controllers/213920-central-web-authentication-cwa-on-cata.html#toc-hId-1941470559

Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is - MAB and if authentication failed, continue.

To allow Central Web Authentication (CWA) in a Cisco ISE authentication policy, the following configuration is required:
Code snippet

authentication local
authentication mab
authentication dot1x

if authentication failed then continue

Use code with caution. Learn more

The first two lines configure local authentication and MAB as the first two authentication methods. The third line configures 802.1X as the third authentication method. The last line tells ISE to continue to the next authentication method if authentication fails.

If authentication fails with MAB, ISE will try authentication with 802.1X. If authentication fails with 802.1X, ISE will redirect the user to the CWA portal.

Selected Answer: A
The tasks required to complete a Cisco ISE WebAuth configuration include the following:
Verify that session services are enabled for the guest and sponsor portals.
Set or verify that the MAB authentication policy will continue after failure due to “User (message authentication code (MAC) not found.”

Selected Answer: A
